sections.heading: Definition.
Leasehold community assistance fund; creation; dispositon [disposition].
Leasehold communities; duties.
sections.text:
Every leasehold community shall:

A. keep all the books, records and accounts in their respective offices in the form prescribed by the local government division;

B. submit to an audit of its books upon request of the local government division;

C. make all reports as may be required by the local government division; and

D. conform to the rules and regulations adopted by the local government division.

History:Laws 1985, ch. 214, § 4.

Cross references.— For local government division,see9-6-3 NMSA 1978.

sections.heading: Inclusion of leasehold community assistance fund in the local government division's annual budget.
sections.text:
The local government division shall calculate the amount of funds to which all leasehold communities are entitled as provided in Subsection B of Section 3 [6-6A-3B NMSA 1978] of the Leasehold Community Assistance Act and shall include that amount in the division's annual budget in the general appropriation act. These budgeted funds shall be used to replenish annually the money available for distribution from the leasehold community assistance fund.

History:Laws 1985, ch. 214, § 5.
